categories.name: Tertiary Education & Student Debt
categories.title: What is your policy on tertiary education and student debt?

questions.question: Introduce government subsidised fees to lower costs and increase student allowances.
Free education should be given as a human right and debt should be alleviated from those who are already overwhelmed with loans.
Retaining interest-free student loans and uphold that  the proportion that students pay of their tertiary study – about 20% - is fair.

Erase the student loan for students staying and working in NZ once their studies are finished, with the requirement that they work for the same number of years as they have studied.  Introduce an universal student allowance which is not subject to parental means testing.
TBC
Introduce a universal student allowance and make living cost adjustments based on location. Introduce more scholarships, internships and cadetships.

Education should have the highest priority in government expenditure.  Scrap student loans for NZ citizens and provide free tertiary education. Graduates would be required to spend a specified time working in NZ.
Make tertiary education free and align Study Link payments with the average living costs associated with the city of residence.
Youth UBI of $10k per year for all those aged 18-23, affordable housing and long-term rental rights. Rental WOF.
Three years of free tertiary education as long as students maintained a pass standard. Past that point, student loans would be available.
Mana

categories.name: Cannibas & Alcohol
categories.title: What is your policy on cannabis and alcohol

questions.question: Legalise cannabis in order for greater management of how and where it is accessed.
Decriminalise and legalise marijuana and the use of it. Introduce a tax on cannabis and use the revenue to fund education and healthcare.
There are no benefits to legalising cannabis that outweigh their harms to society.
Put the question of decriminalising or legalising recreational cannabis to the NZ public. With regard to medicinal cannabis, support access for those who need it under a prescription regime.
TBC
Support the use of medicinal cannabis and spark a greater discussion with the wider community around use of cannabis recreationally.

Increase penalties for the sale of hard drugs and increase funding for police force drug operations. Alcohol and drug abuse awareness programmes will be incorporated into the core curriculum of NZ schools. Medical cannabis use will be permitted.

Greater funding of rehabilitation facilities and new sentencing rules for a more compassionate approach to cannabis possession. Allow suppliers to submit drugs for testing and ensure safety their safety.
Legalise, regulate and tax Cannabis while using the revenue to fund mental health and drug addiction treatment. Increase the legal age of alcohol purchase to 20.
Raise the drinking age to 20 years. Recreational cannabis remains  illegal, but consider authorising of the use of medicinal cannabis.
Mana

categories.name: Unemployment and Poverty
categories.title: What is your policy regarding poverty and unemployment in NZ?

questions.question: Increase all benefits by 20% and lift the minimum wage to $17.5 an hour. Provide all families with a tax credit.
Remove the bureaucracy surrounding food banks in NZ and ensure that supermarket’s excess stock will go directly to food bank shelves.
Support equal citizenship and opportunity regardless of gender, ethnicity, socio-economic position or background.

It is a responsibility of government to ensure that no citizens are allowed to fall below a certain standard of living. Re-introduce services such as free milk and fruit at schools for all children and rid of current neo-liberal attitudes.
TBC
Eliminate poverty in NZ by 2025. Make cost adjustments to all benefits based on location and introduce a living wage for all workers. Implement government depart accountability and performance.
Replace all current benefits and allowances with a basic income but retain supplements for the disabled, their carers, and housing.

Establish regional employment initiatives that work to discover and solve the reasons for unemployment in communities. Ensure that people receive their financial entitlements by funding organisations to give independent advice.

Replace targeted benefits with UBI, $10k per year to the  3 most vulnerable groups (young families with kids Under 3, 65+, 18-23), low-income family support, tax wealth fairly leading to 1/3 income tax cut, 80% kiwis better off.

Poverty is not a monetary issue but a holistic one. Wrap around support is needed, including education and training in areas such as relationships, self care, budgeting. The government should provide funding to community groups who support those in poverty.
Mana

categories.name: Healthcare
categories.title: What is your policy on health care?

questions.question: Engage in a nationwide enquiry into the reasons for poor mental health services in NZ to alleviate its effects. Deliver practical, community based solutions with trained and compassionate professionals.
Develop electronic personal health records which will be owned by all New Zealanders and enable individuals to understand their own health and recall their medical history.
Expand cheaper GP visits, invest $224m extra for mental health and further investment in hospital infrastructure.

See healthcare as a key investment in NZ’s human resource. Continue free doctor visits for under 6 year olds and introduce a certain amount of free doctor visits per year to those over 65 to reduce pressure on hospitals. Address the underfunding of mental health services.
TBC

Free GP visits and prescriptions for under 18 years and free medical and dental care for over 55 years. Increase funding in focused areas such as mental health, maternity care, hospice facilities, and homecare.

Maintain a fully funded health service, from primary care through to major surgery and rehabilitation. Dramatically increase the funding for mental health. Health infrastructure will be funded by the Reserve Bank as interest-free loans through local bodies.
Increased funding of professionals and community based works to take preventative measures against mental health and general health issues. Easier accessibility for people from all backgrounds.
Junk food tax rebated to whole foods, greater mental health funding, ban junk food advertising to kids, healthy star rating compulsory.
Incentivise NZers to take private health insurance by making premiums tax deductible.Oppose abortion. Stop treating mental health as a medical condition and start treating it with trauma counselling.
Mana

categories.name: Transport
categories.title: What is your policy on transport infrastructure?

questions.question: Free buses and trains for people under 19, students, apprentices, and disabled people. Build rail to Auckland airport by 2021, other bus and train projects nationwide, and safer cycling.
Reap the benefits of  the already $20 billion invested to build a safer, more efficient transport system that supports a more competitive economy.

Take emphasis off roads and balance this out with rail and increase the accessibility of public transport to get cars off the roads. Support to shift our domestic fleet from petrol and diesel to electric as soon as practicable.
TBC
Invest in good road and rail networks that link well to air and sea ports as well as provision for cycling and walking in order to support New Zealand’s transport infrastructure.

Aim for a publicly-owned, integrated transport system to all regions. Electrify rail for bulk freight movement. Restoration of Air New Zealand to full public ownership. Research into and development of alternative fuels and renewable energy sources.

Introduce a fully integrated public transport system with an emphasis on bus and rail. Local Government, rather than the central Government, is allocated money to spend on transport developments how it sees fit.
Should be fossil fuel free 2050, and large new investments have to be carbon costed. Electrify our cars + trains, congestion charges.
Become world leaders in innovation rather than poor copy-cats. Call for a thorough engineering report to be done on an alternate modern transport systems within urban areas.
Mana

categories.name: Housing
categories.title: What is your policy on housing?

questions.question: Introduce a Warrant of Fitness for all homes proving their safety to live in. Implement a rent-to-buy scheme from the government and secure rights of renters with tighter mandatory tenancy agreements and fairer rent prices.
Get more houses built faster through planning reform, training infrastructure provision and the Crown Building Programme.

Return NZ to a home owning democracy.  Sell residential sections under long term agreements (up to 25 years) to first home buyers.  Minimise immigration and restrict house and land sales to Kiwis only.
TBC
End homelessness by 2020. Build 90,000 homes over the next 5 years - 30,000 of those in Auckland. Improve tenants’ rights and enforce a compulsory Warrant of Fitness on all homes.
Tax first home buyers half the normal tax rate of the earner. New homes should be built with eco-friendly features such as solar panels, double glazing and grey water systems.
Greater funding and building of social housing with a pathway to ownership by tenants gradually buying their house off the government.
Decent tenant rights (more long-term) and rental Warrant Of Fitness.

Halt immigration for 7-8 months to allow time to build sufficient houses to catch up on our shortage, then reintroduce controlled immigration again. Continue to upgrade existing houses for healthy living .No non citizen or non resident should be able to purchase property in NZ.
Mana

categories.name: Climate Change
categories.title: What is your policy regarding climate change and ways to mitigate it?

questions.question: Support clean energy like solar and wind, tax breaks for electric cars, and ensure polluters pay a price for their pollution to motivate them to reduce it.
100% of electricity to be generated from renewable sources by 2025 and are push for NZ to be a global leader in Green Technologies.
Stay committed to our ambitious Paris Agreement target of 30% below 2005 levels by 2030. Reduce emissions, plant more trees and participate in high-quality international carbon markets.

Progressively phase out the burning of fossil fuels  and instead use renewable energy. Support the establishment of a formal planning process to achieve fossil carbon reduction relevant to NZ in a discussion between government, the businesses, universities and other sectors to ensure that the process will be independent.
TBC
Support the reduction of emission targets as identified in the Paris Agreement. Support Zero Carbon and set emissions and carbon budgets into law.

Withdraw from the Paris agreement to retain sovereignty over any climate-related decisions. Replace the ETS with measures to reduce pollution and provide financial assistance to help industry meet new emissions standards.
Invest $10 million per year allowance for the research into NZ’s environment. Establish an electric vehicle grant, giving people or businesses 30% of the cost.
Fossil fuel free by 2050, restore ETS, 100% renewable energy, polluters to pay, replant erosion prone land.

Pull NZ out of the UN Kyoto and the Paris agreements and put that money towards Research & Development for pollution solutions, to clean up our own environment and then export the innovative technology to other countries.
Mana
